alert.note: Alert for Bighorn Mountains Southeast; Bighorn Mountains West; Casper Mountain; Natrona County Lower Elevations; Northeast Johnson County; Southeast Johnson County (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Air Quality Alert issued September 13 at 11:39AM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...AIR QUALITY ALERT IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM MDT WEDNESDAY... The following message is transmitted on behalf of the Wyoming Department of Environmental Quality, Air Quality Division, and the Wyoming Department of Health. * WHAT...Air Quality Alert for Wildfire Smoke. * WHERE...Portions of Johnson and Natrona Counties including Casper Mountain and the Bighorn Mountains. * WHEN...1 PM Today until 1 PM Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Smoke from wildfires in ID and MT continues to be observed across portions of Johnson and Natrona Counties. The smoke is limiting visibilities at times. There will be a chance some smoke may lift out tonight into Wednesday morning. HEALTH INFORMATION...The Wyoming Department of Health recommends that the elderly, young children, and individuals with respiratory problems avoid excessive physical exertion and minimize outdoor activities during this time. Wildfire smoke is made up of a variety of pollutants, including particulate matter and ozone, which can cause respiratory health effects. Although these people are most susceptible to health impacts, the Department of Health also advises that everyone should avoid prolonged exposure to poor air quality conditions. CURRENT CONDITIONS...The Wyoming Department of Environmental Quality, Air Quality Division offers near real-time air quality data for Wyoming`s monitoring stations and health effects information to help the public interpret current conditions. Current air quality conditions across the state of Wyoming can be found at http://www.wyvisnet.com/.
